ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course surveys popular modalities of medical imaging with a focus on MRI. Other emerging forms of imaging are not explored. I would recommend. It a good foundation for a biomedical imaging career. It does not cover any optical modalities though. There isn't much guidance on the papers.
A great intro to a wide variety of imaging techniques. I would recommend, as I learned a lot.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: the concept of imaging. the ways and criteria to promote imaging modality.

It was good to solidify my foundational knowledge of the imaging field as a whole - my research is very focused on only one modality right now, but I like being up to speed on what's going on with my imaging "cousins."
